title: How to acces Hugo
description: Just a dummy Guide for me
body:
sudo git submodule update --remote --merge
cd /usr/local/blog
sudo hugo server -D
I Just learned that I can set the Date of a post in the future and it will desapear until that date

title: About Me
body:
I’m Dave aka Deleven
I am a Dad, Husband, Dogdaddy, Geek, Nerd, Photographer, Tech enthusiast and somewhat of a weirdo
I think that should already tell you quite a bit about me.
 Here are some more facts about me:
 I’m Swissüá®üá≠  No, I am not made out of money Yes, we do eat other things than cheese and choclate No Switzerlandüá®üá≠ is not Swedenüá∏üá™   I have many talents, but writing and grammar aren’t some of them  I get, that it is kind of ironic to say that and then create a blog in english. But I think much more people can make use of the content on this blog like this, then when I would write it in german. so if you have a problem with bad grammer, this blog is probably nothing for you, sorry  as I am not an english native speaker, it probably won’t change     Oh and I am older then the internet üë¥üèª

title: My Homelab
body:
You will find a link in the Top Navbar to My HomeLab
This will be the place where I list all the Computers/Servers/etc., what software is running on which device and how i set everything up.
This will take quite a while to create, so please be patient
There is nothing more to tell, I just needed to write this down to have a blogpost, for layout purpose etc.
So that there wont just be a boring empty space I will add here some super cool HomeLab/Tech Youtube Channels as inspiration
 DB Tech   The Digital Life   Chris Titus Tech   freeCodeCamp.org   Christopher Lawley   Techno Tim   teqqyde (German Channel üá©üá™)

title: It's alive
description: Yay, my hugo website seems to work
body:
This is just the first post to try things out
Todo can be found in the Github Issues

title: My HomeLab
body:
Homelab Setup 2022 I have accumulated a whole lot of computers/tablets/phones/NAS/etc over the years. Thats why my HomeLab Build is probably a lot different the what you are used to.
Most of my machines have quite low specs, and several different Operating Systems, so I distribute the tasks between them. I handle most of it via SSH, it works ok like that.
Maybe one day i will have a powerfull enough machine to handle all of the tasks at the same time ;) I might also just throw proxmox on my Gaming PC one day and handle everything like that in one place. But for now it seems to work fine like it is.
What is where and on what MacMini
 Ubuntu  Deleven Standard Stack Portainer NGINX Proxy Manager Hugo Minecraft Server     Synology DS918+
 DSM (Disk Station Manager)  Sonarr Radarr NZBGet Portainer Backups (Manual + Active Backup for Business)     WD PR4100
 MyCloud OS  Media     Raspberry Pi 4, 8 GB RAM
 Home Assistant Operating System   Surface Pro 4
 Pop!_OS  Deleven Standard Stack     PC
 Windows 10  Valheim Server VS Code     SP6
 Windows 10   Raspberry Pi 3b (3x)
  M1 Macbook Air 2020 MacOS  VS Code GitHub Desktop Homebrew     iPadPro 2018 12.9
 iPadOS  Blink Working Copy Drafts     iPhone 11
 iOS  Blink Working Copy Drafts
